answers.answer: If you used condoms consistently for vaginal sex and never had a slippage or breakage, your risk is extremely low.  Further, the large majority of commercial sex workers in the US and most industrialized countries are HIV negative.  On the other hand, statistically the odds are that at least 1 or 2 of your "80 to 90" commercial sex workers had HIV.All in all, your odds of being infected are low.  But the only way to know for sure is to be tested.  You need to bite the bullet and do it.  Your rationale against testing of course is irrational:  the blood test does not "pose a life risk"--your behavior does that, not the test.  Just do it.Good luck--  HHH, MD

As I am sure the doctor will say - Protected Sex is protected.  As long as the condom covered the head of your penis, did not break you are fine.  Regarding oral sex, EXTREMELY, EXTREMELY Low risk. So low, I wouldn't worry about it.You're fine.

The other element of irrationality about your desire not to be tested is the presence of the other medical conditions you describe.  Do you avoid getting your blood pressure measured or your blood sugar checked because the results might be bad news?  Your diabetes, sleep apnea, and high BP each (by themselves) are greater threats to your life than HIV.HHH, MD

question: I was separated and subsequently divorced about 3-1/2 years ago. Over the past 3 years I have had about 80 to 90 encounters with different prostitutes. About a third of the encounters involved vaginal sex with a condom and oral sex both with and without a condom. As far as I know with the vaginal sex there never any condom breakage or other issues such as bleeding, herpes, etc. The rest of the encounters involved strictly oral sex, with and without a condom, which I understand is a low or no real risk activity. The last encounter was about 4 months ago, and again there has been no sign of warts, herpes or skin problems.I am a heterosexual non IV drug user, I am being treated for several other diseases (diabetes, sleep apnea, high blood pressure, etc) and I have developed into a worrier about everything. My question is what is my level of risk, I cannot bring myself to have another medical test that may a poses a life risk unless I absolutely have to. I know you cannot give an absolute certain opinion, but I am looking for an informed opinion so I can make a decision. I am unsure why I am suddenly worried now about HIV,when most of the encounters came over a year ago, but the fact is I am.
title: Protected Sex Many Times with Different Prostitutes
